byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic reported from Detroit and Neal E. Boudette from Ann Arbor, Mich.
byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and NEAL E. BOUDETTE

abstract: Google announces it will install its self-driving car technology in fleet of 100 minivans made by Fiat Chrysler; vehicles will be used to further test technology; deal is most prominent example of technology company working with automaker in field that has so far been defined by competition between two sectors.
lead_paragraph: The partnership will equip 100 vehicles with technology to advance and expand Google’s development effort.

headline.main: Google to Get Fiat Chrysler Minivans for Self-Driving Tests
headline.print_headline: Google, Fiat and a Plan for Autos

snippet: The partnership will equip 100 vehicles with technology to advance and expand Google’s development effort.
